div.div: It is the mission of the Ridley School District to create a caring environment that gives all students the opportunity to achieve their fullest personal and academic potential in order to become productive and responsible citizens.

The Census count is mandated by the Constitution and conducted by the U.S. Census Bureau, a nonpartisan government agency. The 2020 Census counts the population in all 50 states, the District of Columbia, and five U.S. territories (Puerto Rico, American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the U.S. Virgin Islands). Each home will receive an invitation to respond to a short questionnaire—online, by phone, or by mail.

The Ridley Educational Foundation (REF) is excited to offer an opportunity to display Green Raider Pride on an official Pennsylvania license plate, which will include the Ridley School District “Rocking R” logo. This license plate is offered through the Pennsylvania Department of Transportation (PennDOT) Special Organization Program, which allows approved groups to promote their organization with a distinctive registration plate. Ridley School District appears to be the first public school district to pursue the opportunity. Anyone residing in the school district or a graduate residing in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania may access an application for their vehicle on the district website at www.ridleysd.org.
READ MORE About RSD License Plate

Hillside Road Pedestrian Bridge will be closed from February 3rd until further notice. The bridge is being replaced as a part of the “Hillside Road Safe Schools” project.

Ridley School District is seated in a suburban area between the cities of Philadelphia and Chester in southeastern Pennsylvania. It serves the residents of Ridley Township, Ridley Park Borough, and Eddystone Borough. Ridley School District encompasses almost 8 square miles and provides educational services to nearly 5,600 pupils. The District fosters a community model by maintaining 7 neighborhood elementary schools. These schools feed the Ridley Middle School, which uses a teaming approach to continue the community theme. The high school welcomes all students to explore diverse academic, arts, athletics, and community service experiences.
